alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 25 at 9:03AM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama below Abiquiu Dam affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Rio Chama below Abiquiu Dam. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 4.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady below flood stage at 4.9 feet. - Action stage is 4.8 feet. - Flood stage is 5.4 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Rio Chama below Abiquiu Da 5.4 4.9 Tue 8 am MDT 4.9 4.9 4.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 915 PM MDT.
